Desirability.description: An evaluation of how appealing the product concept is to the target audience, considering factors such as user needs, preferences, and market demand. This should end with a rating of 1 out of 10.

Viability.description: An evaluation of the business viability of the product concept, including its potential profitability, market fit, and alignment with organizational goals. This should end with a rating of 1 out of 10.

Feasibility.description: An evaluation of the technical and operational feasibility of the product concept, assessing whether it can be realistically developed and implemented. This should end with a rating of 1 out of 10.

Sustainability.description: An evaluation of the sustainability of the product concept, focusing on its long-term environmental, social, and economic impact. This should end with a rating of 1 out of 10.

IdeaRating.description: A summary score that reflects the overall assessment of the product concept based on the evaluations of desirability, viability, feasibility, and sustainability.
